page.title: 01BORDON- AN OUTLINE.
page.content: This survey covers part of the village of Bordon in Hampshire and Kingsley and Oakhanger to the East and North. The whole was once part of the Royal Forest of Woolmer but because of the coarse sandy soils it was reduced to heathland as early as the 15th century.Used as a training area for troops stationed at Aldershot, it's prosperity began in the early part of the century when a permanent camp was built at Bordon.This was enhanced by the building of the Petersfield to Aldershot road (now the A325) and two railways connecting to Bentley in the North and to Longmoor in the South, the latter run by the military as a Royal Engineer's training railway. The closure of the railways in 1968 did not affect the growth of the village. It is now almost a small town with much light industry and services.
